courseTemplate.entry: Numerical value that is used to mark the position of the course in the catalog database.
courseTemplate.id: Numerical value assigned to course based on its 'subject' and its 'courseNumber'. It is the combination of the 'subject ID' and the 'courseNumber' of the course.
courseTemplate.termEffective: Current value of term according to the year and semester. Follows the original Stetson system.
courseTemplate.courseNumber: Numerical value that corresponds to the course number for the course. Ex.: 141 for CSCI141
courseTemplate.subject: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the major or area that the course corresponds with. CSCI for Computer Science, etc.
courseTemplate.subjectCode: Duplication of the value paired with the 'subject' key of the course.
courseTemplate.subjectId: Numerical value assigned to the subject that the course belongs to.
courseTemplate.college: The school that oversees the course. This could be 'College of Arts and Sciences', 'School of Business', etc.
courseTemplate.collegeCode: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the value paired with the 'college' key for the course.
courseTemplate.department: Faculty department that the course corresponds with. Ex: American Studies, Mathematics, etc.
courseTemplate.departmentCode: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the value paired with the 'department' key for the course.
courseTemplate.attributes: A list of all the General Education attributes that this course possesses.
courseTemplate.ceu: Continuing Education Unit. Used in continuing education programs to assist professionals in maintaining their license in their profession.
courseTemplate.courseScheduleTypes: A two-letter abbreviation of the value for the 'scheduleTypeDescription' key of the course.
courseTemplate.scheduleTypeDescription: The full definition of what the value of the 'scheduleType' key represents.
courseTemplate.restrictions: Specifies when this course is offered. Has acceptable values of: ['Fall Only', 'Spring Only', 'Fall and Spring']
courseTemplate.restrictionsPeriod: Specifies how often this course is offered. Has acceptable values of ['Every semester', 'Annually', 'Every two years', 'Every three years', etc.]
courseTemplate.creditHourLow: The minimum number of credits that a student can receive for this course.
courseTemplate.creditHourHigh: The maximum number of credits that a student can receive for this course.
courseTemplate.creditHourIndicator: There are only three acceptable values for this key: [null, 'TO', 'OR']
courseTemplate.subjectDescription: The full definition of what the value of the 'subject' key represents.
courseTemplate.courseDescription: A description of the topics covered in the course and how it might be structured.
courseTemplate.termStart: The Semester during which this course was first offered.
courseTemplate.prerequisites: A list of the prerequisites that are required for a student to register for this course.

progressTemplate.id: Numerical value assigned to course based on its 'subject' and its 'courseNumber'. It is the combination of the course's 'subject ID' and its 'courseNumber'.
progressTemplate.courseNumber: Numerical value that corresponds to the course's number for registration. Ex.: 141 for CSCI141
progressTemplate.subject: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the major or area that the course corresponds with. CSCI for Computer Science, etc.
progressTemplate.courseReferenceNumber: An unique numerical value that is assigned to the course as an identifier to differentiate it from other sections that might be offered.
progressTemplate.section: Alphanumeric value that identifies which instance of this course that the student completed.
progressTemplate.levelCode: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the value of the course's 'levelDescription' key. (UG for Undergraduate)
progressTemplate.levelDescription: The full definition of what the value for the 'levelCode' key represents.
progressTemplate.campusCode: Alphanumeric ID that is associated with where instruction for this course occurred. ('D' for DeLand Campus, 'OL' for Online, etc.)
progressTemplate.termDescription: Alphanumeric value of the semester that the student completed this course.
progressTemplate.gpaHours: A numerical value of the hours that get factored into calculating the student's GPA. If the course is a Pass/Fail, then the value for this key would be '0.000', even if the course was worth 1 unit, or 4 credits.
progressTemplate.hoursAttempted: A numerical value of how many credits the course is worth. It is the maximum credits that the student could possibly receive for completing the course.
progressTemplate.hoursEarned: A numerical value that will not exceed the value of the 'hoursAttempted' key. This is the number of credits that the student earned for completing the course.
progressTemplate.finalGrade: The final grade the student received for the course. On a letter scale of [A+, A, A-, B+, B, B-, C+, C, C-, D+, D, D-, F]. Additional values are [I, P, W, X, XF, NR]
progressTemplate.qualityPoints: A numerical valuation of what the student received as their 'finalGrade'.

progressTrimmedTemplate.id: Numerical value assigned to course based on its 'subject' and its 'courseNumber'. It is the combination of the course's 'subject ID' and its 'courseNumber'.
progressTrimmedTemplate.courseNumber: Numerical value that corresponds to the course's number for registration. Ex.: 141 for CSCI141
progressTrimmedTemplate.subject: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the major or area that the course corresponds with. CSCI for Computer Science, etc.
progressTrimmedTemplate.courseReferenceNumber: An unique numerical value that is assigned to the course as an identifier to differentiate it from other sections that might be offered.
progressTrimmedTemplate.section: Alphanumeric value that identifies which instance of this course that the student completed.
progressTrimmedTemplate.levelCode: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the value of the course's 'levelDescription' key. (UG for Undergraduate)
progressTrimmedTemplate.levelDescription: The full definition of what the value for the 'levelCode' key represents.
progressTrimmedTemplate.campusCode: Alphanumeric ID that is associated with where instruction for this course occurred. ('D' for DeLand Campus, 'OL' for Online, etc.)
progressTrimmedTemplate.termDescription: Alphanumeric value of the semester that the student completed this course.
progressTrimmedTemplate.gpaHours: A numerical value of the hours that get factored into calculating the student's GPA. If the course is a Pass/Fail, then the value for this key would be '0.000', even if the course was worth 1 unit, or 4 credits.
progressTrimmedTemplate.hoursAttempted: A numerical value of how many credits the course is worth. It is the maximum credits that the student could possibly receive for completing the course.
progressTrimmedTemplate.hoursEarned: A numerical value that will not exceed the value of the 'hoursAttempted' key. This is the number of credits that the student earned for completing the course.
progressTrimmedTemplate.finalGrade: The final grade the student received for the course. On a letter scale of [A+, A, A-, B+, B, B-, C+, C, C-, D+, D, D-, F]. Additional values are [I, P, W, X, XF, NR]
progressTrimmedTemplate.qualityPoints: A numerical valuation of what the student received as their 'finalGrade'.

reviewTemplate.id: Numerical value assigned to course based on its 'subject' and its 'courseNumber'. It is the combination of the course's 'subject ID' and its 'courseNumber'.
reviewTemplate.courseNumber: Numerical value that corresponds to the course's number for registration. Ex.: 141 for CSCI141
reviewTemplate.subject: Alphanumeric abbreviation of the major or area that the course corresponds with. CSCI for Computer Science, etc.
reviewTemplate.professor: The name of the professor who provided instruction to the student who submitted this course review.
reviewTemplate.professorRating: A rating, on a scale of 1 to 5 with 5 being the best, given by the student to the professor.
reviewTemplate.postNotes: Does the instructor post the class notes online? Responses: [Yes, No, N/A]
reviewTemplate.extraCredit: Does the instructor offer extra credit? Responses: [Yes, No]
reviewTemplate.flexibility: The instructor is flexible when it comes to unforeseen circumstances. Responses: [Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree, N/A]
reviewTemplate.justBecause: You would take a course just because this instructor was the one teaching it. Responses: [Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree, N/A]
reviewTemplate.questionReaction: How does the instructor respond to questions? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.professorDemeanor: What was the professor's demeanor like? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.professorFeedback: What did you think of the Professor? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.professorAddInfo: Any additional information you would like to share regarding the professor? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.quizFrequency: How often were the quizzes? Responses: [Weekly, Biweekly, Monthly, N/A]
reviewTemplate.quizQuestionType: What type of questions were on the quizzes? Responses (multi-select): [Multiple choice, Short response]
reviewTemplate.quizSetting: Were the quizzes take-home or in-class? Responses (multi-select): [Take-home, In-class, Both]
reviewTemplate.quizToCourseSimilarity: How similar were the quizzes to the content covered in class? Responses: [Same questions, Very similar, Slightly similar, No relation, N/A]
reviewTemplate.quizToAssignmentSimilarity: How similar were the quizzes to the class assignments? Responses: [Same questions, Very similar, Slightly similar, No relation, N/A]
reviewTemplate.quizAddInfo: Any additional information you would like to share regarding the quizzes? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.midterm/final: Was there a Mid-Term and/or Final Exam? Responses: [Mid-Term only, Final Exam only, Both, N/A]
reviewTemplate.cumulativeFinal: Was the Final Exam cumulative? Responses: [Yes, No, N/A]
reviewTemplate.examQuestionType: What type of questions were on the tests/exams? Responses (multi-select): [Multiple choice, Short response]
reviewTemplate.examSetting: Were the tests/exams take-home or in-class? Responses (multi-select): [Take-home, In-class, Both]
reviewTemplate.examType: What type of tests/exams were there? Responses (multi-select): [Normal (multiple choice, short response, etc.), Essay Tests]
reviewTemplate.examAddInfo: Any additional information you would like to share regarding the tests/exams? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.finalGrade: What was your final grade for the course? Responses: [A, B, C, D, F]
reviewTemplate.wisdom: What are some words of wisdom that you would give to a student looking to take this course? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.newApproach: If you were to retake this course, what would you have done differently? Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.textbookPurchase: Did this course require you to purchase textbook(s)? Responses: [Yes, No]
reviewTemplate.textbookRecommendation: Would you recommend purchasing the textbook(s)? Responses: [Yes, No]
reviewTemplate.textbookUse: How much did the professor use the textbook(s)? Responses: ['The book and the professor were one entity.', Every week, Often, Not often, Never]
reviewTemplate.courseLoad: Describe the course load. Response: Text box
reviewTemplate.overallReview: How would you describe the course overall? Response: Text box
